info.title: LoTaR API
info.description: REST API for LoTaR task management. Includes task CRUD, projects, config, and realtime events via SSE.

post.description: Creates a task using project validation and smart defaults. People fields support @me (resolved via config.default_reporter → git user → system username). If auto.set_reporter is enabled in config, reporter is set automatically when not provided. Project may be provided via the JSON body field 'project' (preferred) or the query parameter 'project' (deprecated).

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project prefix for the new task (e.g., TEST)

post.description: Sets the status of a task. Validates against configured workflow states and applies auto-assign rules if enabled.

get.description: Supports built-in filters via named query params (status, priority, type, assignee, tags, project, q). In addition, any other query key is treated as a property filter: declared custom field names can be used directly (e.g., sprint=W35). Assignee supports @me. Multiple values can be provided as CSV and values are matched using case- and separator-insensitive fuzzy matching.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: CSV of statuses (TODO, IN_PROGRESS, VERIFY, BLOCKED, DONE)

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: CSV of priorities (LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH, CRITICAL)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: CSV of types (feature, bug, epic, spike, chore)

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: Assignee filter; supports @me to resolve the current user

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: CSV of tags

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Free-text search

post.description: Updates task fields. People fields support @me. Note: The 'status' field is ignored by this REST route; status changes are handled by CLI. Auto-assign on status change (auto.assign_on_status) applies when status transitions via supported channels.

get.description: Returns a lightweight list of matching tasks for quick lookups. Results are limited to a maximum of 50 items (default 20).

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Query text to match against task id and title.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Filter suggestions to a specific project prefix.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of suggestions to return.

get.summary: List recent commits for a task
get.description: Shows the git commit history impacting the YAML backing the requested task, truncated by the optional limit parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Canonical task identifier (e.g., TEST-123).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of commits to include.

get.summary: Fetch a code snippet for a reference
get.description: Resolves the referenced file and returns a highlighted snippet of the surrounding lines.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Reference token in the form path#Lstart-Lend.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Number of context lines to include before and after when before/after are not specified.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Override number of lines to include before the highlight.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Override number of lines to include after the highlight.

post.summary: Attach a link reference to a task
post.description: Adds a link reference (http/https URL) to task.references unless it already exists.

post.summary: Remove a link reference from a task
post.description: Removes a link reference (http/https URL) from task.references if present.

Assigns the provided task IDs to the selected sprint. Enforces single-sprint membership unless force_single is set. Returns reassignment details including explanatory messages for replaced memberships.
Detaches the provided task IDs from the selected sprint. Returns the same reassignment payload as the assignment endpoint including any cleanup diagnostics.

get.description: Returns lifecycle, completion, and timeline metrics for the selected sprint.

parameters.name: sprint
parameters.description: Sprint identifier (positive integer).

get.description: Returns burndown totals and remaining work series for tasks, points, and hours.

parameters.name: sprint
parameters.description: Sprint identifier (positive integer).

get.description: Aggregates recent sprints with committed vs completed totals and rolling averages.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of sprints to include (defaults to 8).

parameters.name: include_active
parameters.description: When true, include active/overdue sprints in the computation.

parameters.name: metric
parameters.description: Velocity metric to use (tasks, points, or hours).

get.description: Aggregates git commits touching task files into enriched feed items, including per-task change breakdowns.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Earliest commit timestamp (RFC3339). Defaults to 30 days ago.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Latest commit timestamp (RFC3339). Defaults to now.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Filter activity to a single project prefix.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of feed items to return.

get.description: Summarizes activity grouped by author, day, week, or project within the specified window.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Aggregation grouping for the series.

get.description: Returns contribution counts per author based on commits touching task files.
Lists tasks with change counts and most recent commit touching them within the given window.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Filter by commit author name or email substring.

get.description: Server-Sent Events stream of task and config changes. Sends an initial 'retry: 1000' hint and periodic ':heartbeat' comments. Optional 'ready' event can be enabled via LOTAR_SSE_READY=1 and requested per-connection.

parameters.name: kinds
parameters.description: CSV of kinds: task_created, task_updated, task_deleted, config_updated, project_changed

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project prefix filter

parameters.name: ready
parameters.description: When true and LOTAR_SSE_READY=1 is set, emit a one-time ready event after subscription
